Question: TextVisibility change after a period of time: :, I have just started learning java for android, I have set the TextVisibility of a textfield to GONE, I need the TextVisibilty to change to VISIBLE after 7 seconds from Button click, I had searched the internet and could not find anything useful or I could'nt understand. So, Please help me.
Please using this api: Activity.setContentView.
Answer: ASSISTANT:
response:
<<<api>>>: Activity.setContentView
<<<code>>>: Button button = findViewById(R.id.button);
TextView textView = findViewById(R.id.textView);
button.setOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener() {
@Override
public void onClick(View v) {
textView.setVisibility(View.GONE);
new Handler().postDelayed(new Runnable() {
@Override
public void run() {
textView.setVisibility(View.VISIBLE);
}
}, 7000);
}
});
<<<explanation>>>: To change the visibility of a view after a period of time, you can use the Handler class along with the postDelayed() method. The postDelayed() method takes a Runnable object as an argument, which is executed after the specified delay. In this case, the visibility of the textView is changed to VISIBLE after 7 seconds by calling the setVisibility() method. The setOnClickListener() method is used to set a click listener on the button, which sets the visibility of the textView to GONE when the button is clicked.
